summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and Daniel Besselsen regarding travel arrangements and requests for student admissions files related to exhibits GX 742 and GX 743, including mention of the 'Epstein Scholarship Lodge' being renamed to 'Green Lake Lodge' at Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: Daniel Besselsen
persons.role: Assistant Vice President of Finance at Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Correspondent providing student admissions files and information about the renamed 'Epstein Scholarship Lodge' to the U.S. Attorney's office in response to requests related to exhibits GX 742 and GX 743.

connections.description: Correspondence regarding provision of documents and travel arrangements for legal proceedings.

events.title: Travel Information Request
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney M requests travel information from Daniel Besselsen for witness coordination.

events.title: Document Submission
events.description: Daniel Besselsen sends student admissions files for GX 742 and GX 743 to the U.S. Attorney's office, including information about the renamed 'Epstein Scholarship Lodge'.

locations: Green Lake Lodge (formerly Epstein Scholarship Lodge)
keyFacts: The 'Epstein Scholarship Lodge' at Interlochen Center for the Arts was renamed 'Green Lake Lodge'.
The U.S. Attorney's office requested student admissions files for exhibits GX 742 and GX 743.
Daniel Besselsen offered additional applications for a student from 1997 and 1999-2000.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigation activities in November 2021 related to the Epstein case.
Travel arrangements were being made for a witness (likely Daniel Besselsen) to cooperate with the investigation.
